meanings.definition: A fence of wooden stakes or iron railings fixed in the ground, forming an enclosure or defense.
meanings.sent1: The settlers built a palisade around their village to keep out wild animals.
meanings.sent2: The palisade along the border provided protection from invaders.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb over the palisade but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a sturdy palisade against any doubts that crept in.
meanings.sent5: The palisade stood tall and strong, a silent guardian of the village.

meanings.definition: A line of cliffs or steep banks.
meanings.sent1: The palisade of rocks along the coast created a stunning view.
meanings.sent2: We hiked along the palisade, enjoying the breathtaking scenery.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the palisade, looking down at the crashing waves below.
meanings.sent4: The palisade of challenges seemed daunting, but she was determined to overcome them.
meanings.sent5: The palisade of cliffs rose majestically, a natural wonder to behold.
